intro: Capsella cuspidata, commonly known as the mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and small, kidney-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and consist of four petals arranged in a cross shape, a characteristic feature of the Brassicaceae family. The plant produces small, round pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
